intro: Asplenium truncatum var. lobulatum, commonly known as the lobed maidenhair fern, is a rare and delicate fern species native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, lance-shaped fronds that are often lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds, typical of the Dennstaedtiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
